result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornelius Bernard Harris

records.addlTxt: Appointing Counsel at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Cornelius Bernard Harris in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 01.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Appointing Attorney at Count Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Cornelius Bernard Harris in court.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter here on hearing as to defendant's competency to represent himself.  After the colloquy with the Court, the defendant decided he would like to have counsel.  Atty. Obscherning eformed the defendant.  Defendant is NOT ELIGIBLE for a public defender.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Amanda Kremer as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Kremer accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $100.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 8/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Cornelius Bernard Harris in court.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant does qualify for a public defender but would like to represent himself.  Court ordered matter adjourned for an in-person hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cornelius Bernard Harris in court.  Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini under the supervision of Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant DECLINED Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/10/2022@2p
